line-9: Who are we looking for?   We are looking for a Business Change Manager to support the System Operator change and transformation team. We need someone who has experience of ensuring that the needs of end-users are considered throughout the project lifecycle, supporting the development of the project, and gaining buy-in during the project lifecycle. The successful candidate will need to be comfortable to plan, develop and undertake key business change activities such as Change Impact Assessments, Transition Plan and Stakeholder Engagement activities, working within a structured change management approach. With experience of effective communication and engagement tools, this role will require the candidate to work with stakeholders across all levels of Network Rail, and the project team so a positive, pro-active approach and engagement is essential.Â  The candidate must be experienced working in a project environment and need to show flexibility and adaptability to change their plans. The candidate will also need to act as a key part of the project team, supporting key project activities such as period reporting, change risk management and change control, to enable the project to deliver successfully.
line-11: What does the average day look like?  The business change manager will work in full alignment with their project team on a day-to-day basis, undertaking all the business change activities required to support project delivery. Depending on the project lifecycle this could include working to define the change required, development of the business change plan, or undertaking specific business change activities with end users. The business change manager will be accountable for end-user engagement with the project, running a user group with impacted teams, developing communications materials or engaging Trades Union Colleagues.Â    The business change manager will need to work with the Lead Business Change Manager and other project change managers to co-ordinate change activities and ensure that the overall portfolio change is co-ordinated. Your role will involve successfully delivering business transformation through complex projects while ensuring that end users affected by these changes smoothly transition into our day-to-day operations. You'll be the expert in crafting essential change documents within a structured approach, even when working under tight deadlines in a rapidly evolving environment. Your exceptional communication and presentation skills will shine as you tailor your messages to various audiences and project needs. Furthermore, you'll be responsible for nurturing user groups, fostering communities, and actively involving users in their journey. Your understanding of the rail industry will be the catalyst for a bright future in this inclusive and dynamic environment. Join us and make a lasting impact!
